title: FOIA Request: Inspection Reports and Citations for Tobacco Worker Complaints (Occupational Safety and Health Administration)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request: Inspection Reports and Citations for Tobacco Worker Complaints (Occupational Safety and Health Administration)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To whom it may concern, 

I would like to request the inspection reports and any citations for the following complaints filed by tobacco farmworkers to the Department of Labor’s Occupational Safety and Health Administration. 

-UPA# F-1652858, Polek Brothers Tobacco, LLC, UPA Receipt Date 08/31/2020, Inspection Report #1491322
-UPA# F-1634336, J-J Thompson Farms, Inc., UPA Receipt Date 07/27/2020, Inspection Report #1485657
-UPA# F-1788300, Derek Smith Farms, UPA Receipt Date 07/17/2021, Inspection Report #1543120
-UPA# F-1805387, J-J Thompson Farms, Inc., UPA Receipt Date, 08/30//2021, Inspection Report #1551430
-UPA# R-1473394, RICH FARMS, INC., UPA Receipt Date 07/08/2019, Inspection Report #1414909
-UPA# R-1796330, Horace Randy Wood, UPA Receipt Date 08/10/2021

I am a journalist with Civil Eats, and this will be used to further my reporting on health and safety issues pertaining to farmworkers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grey Moran

title: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tobacco Farmworkers Complaints

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tobacco Farmworkers Complaints
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request all complaints related to health and safety submitted to the Department of Labor's Occupational Safety and Health Administration filed by or on behalf of tobacco farmworkers, between December 2021 and November 2022. 

I am a journalist with Civil Eats, and this information will be used for an article pertaining to the health of U.S. farmworkers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grey Moran

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - CIA - Chester Pierce
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning Chester Middlebrook Pierce (March 4, 1927 – September 23, 2016) - famed American psychiatrist and author (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chester_Middlebrook_Pierce)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - FBI - Chester Pierce
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning Chester Middlebrook Pierce (March 4, 1927 – September 23, 2016) - famed American psychiatrist and author (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chester_Middlebrook_Pierce)

Please conduct a thorough search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices - for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. 

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

    Upload documents directly:
    https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Ffoia-fbi-chester-pierce-147780%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2OEi3pjuv1arI66uoG-O4gc%3A1q9crd%3Awmx43SY4qek1A2BNGHkqhth_LYGtEw2B60rOUZvI8EI

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: East Mecklenburg High School 11/13/2003 shooting incident report

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: East Mecklenburg High School 11/13/2003 shooting incident report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The incident report, police narratives, and any investigative reports produced in relation to the East Mecklenburg High School (Charlotte, NC) 11/13/2003 shooting incident, including any documents relating to the presence (or lack thereof) of a school resource officer.

In the event that there are fees, I would request a waiver, as I am a member of the press.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Prayag Gordy

title: Lake Mohegan Fire Department Records, Roster, and Disciplinary Actions (2022-Present)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Lake Mohegan Fire Department Records, Roster, and Disciplinary Actions (2022-Present)
communications.communication:
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 146407
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Date: June 13, 2023

Town of Cortlandt Clerk's Office
1 Heady St,
Cortlandt, NY 10567

Attn: FOIA Officer

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – Records, Roster, and Disciplinary Actions of All Personnel in Lake Mohegan Fire Department

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request access to and copies of all records held by the Town of Cortlandt Clerk's Office pertaining to all personnel, both career and volunteer, of the Lake Mohegan Fire Department.

For the purpose of this request, the records I seek include, but are not limited to:

Detailed call logs for the Lake Mohegan Fire Department, including the nature of each call, response times, involved personnel, and any outcomes or actions taken, from January 1, 2022, to the present.

The most current roster list of the Lake Mohegan Fire Department, including the names, titles, and lengths of service of all active members, both career and volunteer.

Records of any disciplinary actions taken against any member, both career and volunteer, of the Lake Mohegan Fire Department from January 1, 2022, to the present, including the nature of the incidents leading to the actions, the processes followed, and the final outcomes.

Should any portion of the requested records be deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in accordance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(b). If an entire document is exempt, I request a justification, citing specific FOIA exemptions, and provision of an exemption log as per Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973).

Please note your obligation under the law not to destroy any records potentially responsive to this request. Any withholding, redaction, or destruction of responsive records without proper justification constitutes a violation of the FOIA and is subject to litigation, as confirmed in Kissinger v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 445 U.S. 136, 150 (1980).

Enclosed is a letter requesting a fee waiver for the processing of this request. As an independent investigative journalist associated with TransparencyReport.pw, I believe that the information I seek is in the public interest and its disclosure contributes significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government.

If the enclosed waiver is not accepted and there are any potential charges in excess of $200 associated with fulfilling my request, please inform me in advance.

As stipulated by the FOIA, I look forward to your response within twenty business days (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i)).

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Jordan Lassiter
Independent Investigative Journalist
TransparencyReport.pw
Email: Jordan@Lassiter.eu
Phone: 1-845-748-0329

Enclosure: Fee Waiver Request Letter

Please be aware: All communications related to this request, including incoming and outgoing communications, will be publicly available on MuckRock.com. Additionally, any correspondence in relation to this request will be instantly published on the platform.

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Lake Mohegan Fire Department Records, Roster, and Disciplinary Actions (2022-Present)

Best,

Laroue Rose Shatzkin
Cortlandt Town Clerk

Cortlandt Manor, NY 10567

title: Request – Records, Roster, and Disciplinary Actions of All Personnel in Buchanan Engine Co #1

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request – Records, Roster, and Disciplinary Actions of All Personnel in Buchanan Engine Co #1
communications.communication:
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 146407
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Date: June 13, 2023

Village of Buchanan Clerk's Office
236 Tate Avenue
Buchanan, NY 10511

Attn: FOIA Officer

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – Records, Roster, and Disciplinary Actions of All Personnel in Buchanan Engine Co #1

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request access to and copies of all records held by the Village of Buchanan Clerk's Office pertaining to all personnel, both career and volunteer, of Buchanan Engine Co #1.

For the purpose of this request, the records I seek include, but are not limited to:

Detailed call logs for Buchanan Engine Co #1, including the nature of each call, response times, involved personnel, and any outcomes or actions taken, from January 1, 2022, to the present.

The most current roster list of Buchanan Engine Co #1, including the names, titles, and lengths of service of all active members, both career and volunteer.

Records of any disciplinary actions taken against any member, both career and volunteer, of Buchanan Engine Co #1 from January 1, 2022, to the present, including the nature of the incidents leading to the actions, the processes followed, and the final outcomes.

Should any portion of the requested records be deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in accordance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(b). If an entire document is exempt, I request a justification, citing specific FOIA exemptions, and provision of an exemption log as per Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973).

Please note your obligation under the law not to destroy any records potentially responsive to this request. Any withholding, redaction, or destruction of responsive records without proper justification constitutes a violation of the FOIA and is subject to litigation, as confirmed in Kissinger v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 445 U.S. 136, 150 (1980).

Enclosed is a letter requesting a fee waiver for the processing of this request. As an independent investigative journalist associated with TransparencyReport.pw, I believe that the information I seek is in the public interest and its disclosure contributes significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government.

If the enclosed waiver is not accepted and there are any potential charges in excess of $200 associated with fulfilling my request, please inform me in advance.

As stipulated by the FOIA, I look forward to your response within twenty business days (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i)).

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Jordan Lassiter
Independent Investigative Journalist
TransparencyReport.pw
Email: Jordan@Lassiter.eu
Phone: 1-845-748-0329

Enclosure: Fee Waiver Request Letter

Please be aware: All communications related to this request, including incoming and outgoing communications, will be publicly available on MuckRock.com. Additionally, any correspondence in relation to this request will be instantly published on the platform.

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request – Records, Roster, and Disciplinary Actions of All Personnel in Buchanan Engine Co #1
communications.communication:
This letter is meant to inform you that your request has been received by the Village Clerk’s Office, the FOIL (Freedom of Information) Access Officer.

Upon completion of the review of your request we will notify you within twenty (20) days of the date of this acknowledgement whether your request will be granted or denied, in whole or in part.

If there are any charges associated with your request, you will be notified of that amount.


Cindy Kempter
Village Clerk
Village of Buchanan

title: Request for documents containing the name "Scott Huminski"

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for documents containing the name "Scott Huminski"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all documents/records referring to Scott Huminski or containing the name of Scott Huminski during the time period of 2010 - 2015.  During this time period Scott Huminski was a resident of Gilbert, Arizona or Bonita Springs, Florida.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be processed by a representative of the news media/press and made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

scott huminski

communications.subject: RE: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for documents containing the name "Scott Huminski"
communications.communication: Supply only documents generated after your last production via the muckrock.com platform concerning Bruce Hume.

communications.subject: RE: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for documents containing the name "Scott Huminski"

I wanted to follow up on the following Connecticut Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on June 14, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.
